author: Christopher J. Merz
title: Combining Classifiers Using Correspondence Analysis
window: with error rates around 80 percent. This empirically demonstrates PV's known sensitivity to learned models with highly correlated errors. On the other hand, PV performs well on the glass and wave data sets where the errors of the learned models are measured to be fairly uncorrelated. Here, SCANN performs similarly to PV, but S-BP and S-Bayes appear to be overfitting by making erroneous predictions
